intro: Sibbaldia pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are divided into five distinct lobes, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Sibbaldia pentaphylla is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
